author: pburba
msg: Fix Issue #3158. Merged deletions causing non-inheritable mergeinfo in
When merging to a target which has missing subtrees, our merge tracking code
puts explicit mergeinfo on the missing subtrees parent and siblings.  The
parent gets non-inheritable ranges describing the merge and the siblings
get normal ranges.  This is all to prevent the missing subtree from
inheriting incorrect mergeinfo.  This change *stops* categorizing subtrees
scheduled for deletion as missing and so suppresses the aforementioned
(get_mergeinfo_paths): Tweak doc string and comments to reflect the above.
(mergeinfo_recording_in_skipped_merge): Tweak test expectations to line up
(test_list): Remove XFail from merge_loses_mergeinfo test.  The only reason
this test has been failing is because the old behavior regarding scheduled
for deletion paths was not expected.  Now that that behavior is gone, the
